headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Apple Stock Climbs; Eli Lilly Slumps After Disappointing Trial Results
summary: The S&P 500 slid 0.1% on Thursday, Aug. 7, 2025, as new tariffs took effect, raising import duties on goods from numerous U.S. trading partners.

headline: Solventum raises annual profit forecast on strength in surgical equipment
summary: Medical device makers have benefited from a surge in demand as more people, particularly older Americans, seek health care services and surgical procedures.  Minnesota-based Solventum is one of the largest providers of sterilization devices, wound dressings, medical tape and other hospital consumables used by healthcare facilities.  More than half of its revenue comes from its MedSurg business, which provides wound dressings and surgical equipment.

headline: Zimmer Biomet (NYSE:ZBH) Exceeds Q2 Expectations, Stock Soars
summary: Medical device company Zimmer Biomet (NYSE:ZBH) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 7% year on year to $2.08 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.07 per share was 4.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Zimmer Biomet raises annual profit forecast on strong demand for medical devices
summary: Zimmer Biomet Holdings raised its full-year adjusted profit forecast and beat second-quarter earnings expectations on Thursday, bolstered by accelerating demand for its hip and knee implants. Medical device makers have benefited from a surge in demand as more people, particularly older Americans, sought health care services and surgical procedures. The demographic shift toward an aging population continues to fuel robust procedure volumes across orthopedic specialties.

raw.headline: Zimmer Biomet raises annual profit forecast on strong demand for medical devices

The demographic shift toward an aging population continues to fuel robust procedure volumes across orthopedic specialties.

headline: Zimmer Biomet Announces Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. (NYSE and SIX: ZBH) today reported financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The Company reported second quarter net sales of $2.077 billion, an increase of 7.0% over the prior year period, an increase of 5.4% on a constant currency1 basis and an increase of 2.8% on an organic constant currency basis. Net earnings for the second quarter were $152.8 million, or $411.2 million on an adjusted1 basis.
